title: Chelsea News: Pat Nevin picks out players 'reborn' under Frank Lampard
text:
Willian, Jorginho and Tammy Abraham have all earned praise this season (Picture: Visionhaus)

Former Chelsea winger Pat Nevin has picked out Jorginho and Willian as two players vastly improved under Frank Lampard, while also praising the work-rates of Tammy Abraham and Mason Mount.

The Blues have found some form under their new manager, winning three of their last four league games, only suffering a narrow defeat to Liverpool in that time.

After a seemingly disastrous start to the season, which saw Chelsea lose 4-0 away to Manchester United, they have recovered impressively and now sit fifth in the table.

Nevin puts this resurgence down to a strong unity throughout the squad, management and supporters, and a vastly improved work-rate under Lampard.

‘There is a great affinity being built between our fans and the players just now,’ Nevin told the official Chelsea website. ‘We know the initial reasons; this is Frank’s team so we are bound to be on board, the kids coming through are our kids so once again we are onside.

‘But look around and consider everyone else and the obvious work-rate and spirit from them, it has been superb this season even during the tougher times.

Frank Lampard has been getting the best out of Willian (Picture: AFP via Getty Images)

‘Take Jorginho, the statistics alone will tell you about his incredible work-rate but it is his passion for every tackle and every chase that shines almost as much as his ability on the ball. Willian obviously is reborn as well but try thinking of someone in the group that isn’t giving everything for every moment, it is impossible.

‘Tammy Abraham works until his legs run out and is often replaced but that is a positive sign that he is giving everything, not a negative one that he is playing badly.

‘There looks as though there are two Mason Mounts on the field most weeks as he seems to have the ability to turn up everywhere. On top of that have a look at the attitude of those coming off the bench. None of the subs are giving anything less than everything they have, whether it is for 30 minutes or 10.’

The Blues have the chance to extend their winning run when they host Newcastle at Stamford Bridge on Saturday afternoon.

Abraham and Mount will return from their international duty with England and look to keep their impressive goal-scoring seasons going with Abraham the joint top-scorer in the Premier League with eight goals and Mount netting four times from midfield.
